p.s: The Sonnet 116 from William Shakespeare has 14 lines with three quatrains and an ending couplet.
In the first quatrianquatrain he writes about the fact that our mind changes when we are in love.
We don't see relevant facts anymore or we don't wanna see them anymore.
Love does not change when there is alteration it develops all the time.
It doesn't end of one of them is change.
The second quatrianquatrain is about that love is the star to every ship with helps thethem to navigate their ships.
Love helps us to find our way.
If two people are in love but the distance is big there will always be a way for them to be together.
In the third quatrianquatrain is goes about the never ending love.
Love does not agesage and it hold on for a long time.
It is a process of time and love gets bigger and bigger.
The ending rhyming couplet is about the fact that if this is wrong Shakespeare will never writting anything anymore.
